instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Hello again, I have cleaned the board as well as possible but the keyboard and trackpad don't work. I see this post [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-trackpad-and-keyboard-not-working.57146/[/URL]

My voltages (only battery and board) no screen keyboard or trackpad etc...

<CHIP>U4810</CHIP> 

1: 3.31V 
2: 0.0V
3: 3.31V
4: 0V
5: 3.31V
6: 3.31V
7: 0V
8: 3.31V

Replace <CHIP>U8000</CHIP>? Any ideas? thanks !

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
No keyboard/trackpad on macOS, nor before?
Cannot acces boot menu?

Try known good trackpad flex/board.
At least inspect trackpad flex terminals and connectors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
I have cleaned the connector of the logic board again.

I have tried a new flex (trackpad to logic board) with new trackpad and new keyboard but same problem.

I can't access the boot menu. On the login screen, only the power key responds. Locking / unlocking screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level.
If low, try disconnecting LIO flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
With IOL Flex connected it does not turn on the computer, only orange light on charger but without battery. I don't understand.

I have tried a SMC reset (crtl + alt + caps + power button) and the charger responds. When I release the power key, the led changes to green and returns to orange.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> level= 3.39v

EDIT: I have tried doing a SMC reset with shift crtl alt and power keys and the light turns green and back to orange. This means that it recognizes the keyboard and responds ... I don't know if this helps.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
SMC reset has nothing to do with basic function of keyboard; is implemented by hardware (inside trackpad board)!

Check <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> and L4820.
Also check all resistors related with trackpad connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>=3,3v (without flex i/o board) and 0v (with flex I/o board) mode ohms value infinite
L4820= 4,98v (w/o flex i/o board)

I check <RESISTOR>R4850</RESISTOR>,51,52,53 is good.

I don't have <RESISTOR>R4841</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R4842</RESISTOR>. I have only <RESISTOR>R4843</RESISTOR>=0,02 (scale 200)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
So <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> disapperas when LIO flex connected?
Check diode mode at <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o LIO flex connected.
Did you try another LIO board/flex?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
So <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> disapperas when LIO flex connected? ---> If I connect the charger with the flex i / o connected, the fan does not work and I have no voltage. If I connect the charger if the fan works and at that moment I connect the i / o flex (I understand that it is dangerous) the tension is maintained and the fan too.

Check diode mode at <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> w/ and w/o LIO flex connected. ---->  don't have continuity with GND I have checked all the line in all the components of the board and I think I have done it well

Did you try another LIO board/flex? LIO flex and board is new (I have two boards, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage, with same trouble)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> water damage don't work keyboard and trackpad
threads.message:
"don't have continuity with GND"
Can you post the readings???
Not only pure short is bad!
As you have two boards, compare the readings...
